1.rationale:
I want to take a moment to map things out.

Currently, our snake occupies two cells: its head at (9,8) (we reached it by moving RIGHT last turn to grab the apple) and its body segment (the “tail”) remains at (8,8). That means we must avoid moving back into (8,8).

Looking at the nearest apples:
• Apple at (6,5) is (dx, dy) = (–3, –3) from our head.
• Apple at (7,4) is (dx, dy) = (–2, –4).

Both are down and to the left of our current head position (9,8). We can’t move left because that would send us into our own body at (8,8). Our safe options are UP (to (9,9)) and DOWN (to (9,7)). While UP is safe, going UP moves us in the opposite vertical direction from our apples. Instead, moving DOWN to (9,7) not only stays within bounds but also brings us closer vertically to the cluster of apples.

Thus, the safest and strategically best move is to go DOWN.

Next move: DOWN.

To get to the apple at (6, 2), I can move RIGHT to (5, 3), then continue moving RIGHT to (6, 3), and finally move DOWN to (6, 2) to collect the apple. This path avoids immediate danger from the enemy snake and gives me room to maneuver after collecting the apple.

Therefore, the next move is: RIGHT.

Let's summarize the situation and our reasoning:

1. Our snake’s current head is at (9,7) with its body (the tail) at (9,8). (Remember that by moving DOWN last turn, the head moved from (9,8) to (9,7) and the old head became part of our body.)

2. Our nearby apples are at (6,5) and (7,4) (along with apples farther away). Both of these lie to the left and down from our current head. 

3. From (9,7) our legal moves are:
 • UP → (9,8) but that cell is occupied by our own body.
 • RIGHT → (10,7) is off the board.
 • DOWN → (9,6) is safe but it only moves us downward.
 • LEFT → (8,7) is safe and brings us closer to the apples horizontally.

4. Since our goal is to reach the apple cluster—and (8,7) positions us closer to (6,5) and (7,4)—the best move at this moment is to go LEFT.

Thus, my next move is: LEFT.

2.rationale:
Given the current situation, the nearest apple is to the right at (6, 2). However, moving directly towards it by going right to (5, 0) and then up to (5, 2) would put me in a position where I have no escape route, as I would be against the wall with the enemy snake above me.

Instead, I should take a route that allows me to collect the apple while keeping a safe distance from the enemy snake and avoiding being trapped. The best strategy seems to be moving towards the apple at (6, 2) while keeping the option to move in any direction after collecting it.

Therefore, the next move is: RIGHT.
